title: Quick Intro for wcswatin Package
text: wcswatin (Climate & Weater SWAT input) open-source R package preparing weather climate data different sources input Soil & Water Assessment Tool (SWAT). Currently two blocks processing routines implemented, one pre-processing NetCDF tif raster files made available increasing number data-providing institutions around globe second one upscaling physical station data interpolation methods.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Reginal Exavier. Author, maintainer. Peter Zeilhofer. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Exavier R, Zeilhofer P (2025). wcswatin: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN). R package version 0.0.1, https://github.com/reginalexavier/wcswatin.
code: @Manual{,   title = {wcswatin: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)},   author = {Reginal Exavier and Peter Zeilhofer},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.0.1},   url = {https://github.com/reginalexavier/wcswatin}, }

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: wcswatin (Weather & Climate SWAT Input) open-source R package preparing weather climate data different sources input Soil & Water Assessment Tool (SWAT). package provides two main workflows: Raster/NetCDF Processing: Extract process climate data global gridded datasets (ERA5-Land, GPM IMERG, PERSIANN, etc.) Station Data Interpolation: Upscale point measurements weather stations using trend surface interpolation Developed funding Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund (CEPF).

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: Process NetCDF GeoTIFF raster files multiple climate data providers Spatial temporal data extraction specific watersheds Trend surface interpolation station data upscaling Gap-filling routines station data Direct output formatting SWAT model input files Optimized large datasets parallel processing support

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: Install development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("reginalexavier/wcswatin")

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
code: library(wcswatin)  # Process NetCDF climate data climate_data <- input_raster(   raster_file = "path/to/climate_data.nc",   watershed = "path/to/watershed.shp",   var_name = "precipitation" )  # Interpolate station data station_data <- ts_to_point(   my_folder = "path/to/station_files",   targeted_points_path = "path/to/centroids.shp",   poly_degree = 2 )

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: Conceptual workflow wcswatin package

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: input_raster(): Load NetCDF GeoTIFF files SpatRaster objects input_table(): Load tabular data validation input_vector(): Load spatial vector data (shapefiles, etc.) var_names(): List available variables NetCDF files

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: study_area_records(): Extract grid points within watershed boundaries layervalues2pixel(): Extract time series grid cell cube2table(): Convert raster data cube tabular format daily_aggregation(): Aggregate raster data daily time steps tbl_from_references(): Extract raster values reference points

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: point_to_daily(): Import organize daily station data files_to_table(): Consolidate multiple station files single table table_to_files(): Split consolidated data back individual files fill_gap(): Fill missing data using correlation methods ts_to_point(): Trend surface interpolation specific points (watershed centroids) ts_to_area(): Trend surface interpolation create continuous raster surfaces save_daily_tbl(): Save daily tables SWAT format

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: var_main_creator(): Generate SWAT input metadata tables main_input_var(): Create main variable input tables SWAT rh_calculator(): Calculate relative humidity variables windspeed_calculator(): Calculate wind speed components

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: count_na(): Check data completeness missing values summary_table(): Generate statistical summaries summary_plot(): Visualize data distributions unit_converter(): Convert measurement units

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: package works spatial data WGS 84 geographic coordinate system (EPSG:4326), standard format climate datasets.

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: Climate Reanalysis: ERA5-Land, MERRA-2, NCEP Satellite Precipitation: GPM IMERG, PERSIANN, CHIRPS Station Data: Standard SWAT weather file format

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: Vignettes: Detailed tutorials workflows Function Reference: ?function_name visit package documentation Examples: Run example(function_name) usage examples

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: Bug Reports: GitHub Issues Réginal Exavier: reginalexavier@rocketmail.com Peter Zeilhofer: zeilhoferpeter@gmail.com

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: use wcswatin research, please cite:
code: @software{wcswatin2025,   author = {Exavier, Reginal and Zeilhofer, Peter},   title = {wcswatin: Weather & Climate SWAT Input},   year = {2025},   url = {https://github.com/reginalexavier/wcswatin} }

title: Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
Weather & Climate SWAT INput (WCSWATIN)
text: project funded Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund (CEPF). Note: package active development. Functions features may change.

text: Count amount percentage NA table column

code: count_na(dataset, percent = FALSE)

text: dataset dataframe containing rainfall data different gauges columns. percent logical, controls whether calculate amount percentage NA.

title: Count the amount or percentage of NA in a table by column — count_na

what: Convert a Cube format data into a Table format — cube2table
title: Convert a Cube format data into a Table format — cube2table
text: function extracts values NetCDF/raster layer converts table format containing values pixels layer name two columns. pixel identified ID (row col), layer name represents date data collected. layers stacked single table, layer differentiated column layer_name containing date data collected. function, due large amount data, counts structure parallel processing based future package speed process. default, computation done sequential mode future::plan(future::sequential), parallel processing, user must change desired mode (ex: future::plan(future::multisession, workers = 6)).

title: Convert a Cube format data into a Table format — cube2table
code: cube2table(   input_path,   var = NA,   n_layers,   study_area,   future_scheduling = 1,   missing_value = -99,   final_dir = NULL,   side_effect = "only",   temp_dir = NULL,   clean_after = FALSE )

title: Convert a Cube format data into a Table format — cube2table
text: input_path Path NetCDF raster file. var variable extracted. default NA. NetCDF files containing multiple variables, user must provide name variable extracted. file contains one variable, user can leave argument NA. n_layers Number layers raster file extracted study_area table 'study_area_records' future_scheduling Controling future scheduled distributed workers. default 1, means future scheduled core. See documentation future package details future.apply::future_lapply(). missing_value value used data missing final_dir directory save final table. NULL, final table saved. side_effect side effect function. default "", means function save final table disk (final_dir provided). options "" "none". "", function save final table disk return within R environment. "none", function return final table whithin R environment. temp_dir directory save intermediate tables. directory already exists, tables saved existing directory. directory exist, created. NULL, tables saved temporary directory. clean_after Logical. TRUE, directory intermediate tables deleted process finished. FALSE, directory kept. default FALSE. temp_dir NULL, implies tables saved temporary directory, temp_dir deleted process finished.

title: Convert a Cube format data into a Table format — cube2table
text: table containing : ID: pixel ID (row col); values: values pixel; layer_name: layer name (date data collected).

what: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly dataset — daily_aggregation
title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly dataset — daily_aggregation
text: https://confluence.ecmwf.int/display/CKB/ERA5+family+post-processed+daily+statistics+documentation # nolint: line_length_linter

title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly dataset — daily_aggregation
code: daily_aggregation(   folder_in,   folder_out,   pattern = ".txt$",   from = "2002-01-01 00",   to = "2021-05-31 23",   take_out_first_record = TRUE,   aggregation_function = mean,   mode = c("agg_fun", "max_min", "last_value")[1],   na.rm = FALSE )

title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly dataset — daily_aggregation
text: folder_in Path input files folder_out Path save transformed files pattern optional regular expression. file names match regular expression returned. first date series, including hour part. last date series, including hour part. take_out_first_record Logical. TRUE, first record input file removed. useful first record hour 00:00, corresponds previous day. length hour must length hours input files. aggregation_function function use hourly groups like mean, sum, mode, etc mode mode aggregation. options agg_fun, max_min last_value. na.rm logical value indicating whether NA values removed computation proceeds.

title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly dataset — daily_aggregation
text: Files daily resolution

title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly dataset — daily_aggregation
text: function allows aggregate hourly observations daily time series. function aggregation can informed aggregation_function parameter, parameter takes function argument. default function mean, daily average returned. function create daily aggregation hourly dataset. function aggregation can informed aggregation_function parameter, parameter takes function argument. default function mean, daily average returned. Alternatively, user can choose mode parameter inform function use choosing agg_fun, max_min, last_value. agg_fun use function informed aggregation_function parameter. max_min return maximum minimum values day. last_value return last value day, useful variables like precipitation last value day accumulated precipitation.

what: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly datacube — datacube_aggregation
title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly datacube — datacube_aggregation
text: https://confluence.ecmwf.int/display/CKB/ERA5+family+post-processed+daily+statistics+documentation # nolint: line_length_linter

title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly datacube — datacube_aggregation
code: datacube_aggregation(   input_path,   output_filename = "",   fun = sum,   cores = 1,   ... )

title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly datacube — datacube_aggregation
text: input_path Path datasetcube output_filename Path output file fun Function applied datasetcube (default sum). function must function takes vector input returns single value. main functions used : Sum, Mean, Min, Max, First Last. last, use dplyr::last. use customized function say, example "min", use use format fun = \(x) min(x). See terra::tapp() information. cores Number cores use aggregation. Default 1. See terra::tapp() information. See terra::tapp() information. ... Additional arguments pass names_to_date()

title: Create a daily aggregation from an hourly datacube — datacube_aggregation
text: raster object aggregated data

title: Series of Pixel Values — layervalues2pixel
text: layer_values List. Values extracted per raster layer (cube2table()). main_tbl table pixel metadata (e.g., main_input_var()), used name output table. col_name Column name SWAT input table. Typically first date time series (e.g., "20220101"). inline_output Logical. TRUE, returns list data.tables. path_output Directory write one file per pixel inline_output = FALSE. append Logical. TRUE, append existing files; otherwise overwrite.

title: Series of Pixel Values — layervalues2pixel
text: list tables (inline_output = TRUE) set files path_output (one pixel).

Inform start date serie format yyyymmdd. end_date character. Inform end date serie format yyyymmdd. interval charactere. Inform inteval betwenn two observations. See function x na_value numeric. Value encoded available, use NA NA. negatif_number logical. Inform negative values kept. prefix character. prefix naming table format "prefix+date". detail.

what: Calculate the Relative Humidity from dewpoint and ambient temperature — rh_calculator
title: Calculate the Relative Humidity from dewpoint and ambient temperature — rh_calculator
text: function performs calculation relative humidity dewpoint ambient temperature input applying formula: \(RH = 100*10^(m*[(Td/(Td+Tn)) - (Tambient/(Tambient+Tn)]))\). \(m\) \(Tn\) constants (Vaisala, 2013).

title: Calculate the Relative Humidity from dewpoint and ambient temperature — rh_calculator
code: rh_calculator(   folder_dpt,   folder_tas,   folder_out,   file_name_output = "rh",   m_value = 7.591386,   Tn_value = 240.7263,   pattern = ".txt$" )

title: Calculate the Relative Humidity from dewpoint and ambient temperature — rh_calculator
text: folder_dpt Path input 2m dewpoint temperature files Td. folder_tas Path input Near-Surface Air Temperature files Tambient. folder_out Path save transformed files file_name_output Character string Relative humidity files output. m_value value constant m (Vaisala, 2013). Tn_value value Tn (Triple point temperature 273.16 K), constant (Vaisala, 2013). pattern optional regular expression. file names match regular expression returned.

title: Calculate the Relative Humidity from dewpoint and ambient temperature — rh_calculator
text: Files temporal resolution input

title: Calculate the Relative Humidity from dewpoint and ambient temperature — rh_calculator
text: VAISALA (2013) HUMIDITY CONVERSION FORMULAS, Calculation formulas humidity.

what: wcswatin: Climate & Weather SWAT Input. — wcswatin-package
title: wcswatin: Climate & Weather SWAT Input. — wcswatin-package
text: wcswatin (Climate & Weather SWAT input) open-source R package preparing weather climate data different sources input Soil & Water Assessment Tool (SWAT), funded Critical Ecosystem Partnership Fund (CEPF). Currently two blocks processing routines implemented, one pre-processing NetCDF tif raster files made available increasing number data-providing institutions around globe second one upscaling physical station data interpolation methods. processing used datasets MUST geographic coordinates using WGS 84 datum.

title: wcswatin: Climate & Weather SWAT Input. — wcswatin-package
text: Reginal Exavier reginalexavier@rocketmail.com, Peter Zeilhofer zeilhoferpeter@gmail.com

what: Calculate the wind speed from Eastward and Northward Near-Surface Wind — windspeed_calculator
title: Calculate the wind speed from Eastward and Northward Near-Surface Wind — windspeed_calculator
text: function performs calculation wind speed Eastward Northward Near-Surface Wind input applying formula: \(ws = \sqrt(u^2 + v^2)\).

title: Calculate the wind speed from Eastward and Northward Near-Surface Wind — windspeed_calculator
code: windspeed_calculator(   folder_uas,   folder_vas,   folder_out,   col_name = "20020101",   file_name_output = "ws",   pattern = ".txt$" )

title: Calculate the wind speed from Eastward and Northward Near-Surface Wind — windspeed_calculator
text: folder_uas Path input Eastward Near-Surface Wind files (u component). folder_vas Path input Northward Near-Surface Wind files (v component). folder_out Path save transformed files col_name column name tables output. Usually, first date time series. file_name_output Character string Wind speed files output. pattern optional regular expression. file names match regular expression returned.

title: Calculate the wind speed from Eastward and Northward Near-Surface Wind — windspeed_calculator
text: Files temporal resolution input.

title: wcswatin 0.0.1
text: Initial release wcswatin (Weather & Climate SWAT INput) package preparing weather climate data input Soil & Water Assessment Tool (SWAT).

title: wcswatin 0.0.1
text: Process NetCDF GeoTIFF raster files multiple climate data providers Temporal spatial aggregation tools Gap filling missing data handling Unit conversion utilities weather variables Summary statistics visualization functions File management batch processing utilities

title: wcswatin 0.0.1
text: Comprehensive test suite cross-platform support (Windows, macOS, Linux) CI/CD GitHub Actions (R-CMD-check, test-coverage, pkgdown) Documentation website available https://reginalexavier.github.io/wcswatin/
